Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2013 07:15AM annika12 wrote: hi , I'm scheduled for surgery Dec 5th !!! I'm looking forward to it , for me its the ending of treatment started in June !!! I'm having a scar tissue clean up , lymph node "tail" removal and lymph node removal !! The tail removal need a wire before surgery. My other surgeries I was twilighted so I'm a little worried about how I will feel after being under all the way for the first time. My scans show no cancer so hoping for a complete chemo success when the path report come back. I'm cleaning , decorating and cooking up a storm ....the shopping my hubby can do ;) !! I will be using a lot of ice.....pain killers make me sick :( My surgeon says we will try something new but the thought of being sick doesn't sound good !!

Posts.Title: Scared LanaM Sparkytheimp

Posts.Content: annika12 wrote: So I had 2 clear mammograms 2 clear ultra sounds a positive lymph biopsy (carcinoma with papillary features) a MRI that kinda showed something maybe, another ultrasound that verified something maybe,2 more biopsies tomorrow, surgical biopsy on tuesday,upper body Ct on Thursday ans lower Ct on Sunday!!! Oh and a chest xray and bloodwork. All in two weeks.Im worried its somewhere difficult to treat or what if they dont find the source!!! Never wished for cancer finding but sure would make it easier if they found a cell or two tomorrow :( Anyone else out there with anything like it?? Dx 5/13/2013, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 5/28/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 6/27/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 12/6/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary Hormonal Therapy 3/1/2014 Dx 2/30 nodes Targeted Therapy Herceptin (trastuzumab) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Winter 2013-2014 Rads TeamKim mouse9587

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2014 12:17PM annika12 wrote: the only way I can get over the fatigue is to ignore it lol napping makes it worse !! Through my entire ordeal (started in may2013) I have kept myself on a strict eating, exercising, resting and sleeping schedule it seam to work for me :) I'm glad its winter but also can't wait for spring and not so many doctor appointments !!!! I have come to really really not like Mondays ....weekends I feel so "normal" and then SLAM Monday hits you in the face.......I'm a cancer patient again :(
Posts.Title: Winter 2013-2014 Rads TeamKim mouse9587

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2013 10:03PM annika12 wrote: Im so sorry you had to join us,you are not alone!! 1.My port hurt the day after placement but no problems now.I had it done in surgery room, quick and easy!! 2.I cut my waist long hair to a bob cut at diagnosis and then super short on day 13 when it was coming out in clumps ... mostly it was really messy so it was nice to have it gone. 3.SE for me with AC was very very hard, be prepared with meds for all possibilities. You will get through it...it kills cancer!! Taxol so far is going good...no SEs to speak of. 4. Eat as healthy as you can....for me each AC brought different tastes. Dont eat what you love...it changes your tastes for it. 5. Weight gain or loss can be taken care of after chemo. Feel good and be good to yourself. 6. Being with my boys is what makes me feel most normal.You are a mother and you will find the strength you need...together you will go on!! Find a few friends and let them help you !!
Posts.Title: Scared and Anxious. Looking for support/advice Jaybird26 Jaybird26

Posts.Content: May 29, 2013 12:42AM annika12 wrote: Im sorry you are here but glad you found this site. Saved my sanity the first frightful nights !!! There is a ton of good information on here but remember to breathe and wait for facts from your doctors. Waiting and testing is scary and hard but hang in there and try not to let you mind run away with your thoughts. Im much older then you (43) also with no history or "reason" for this.....just shitty luck I guess. I hope your tests come back good and no treatment needed BUT if you need it it's there and treatment has come a looong way!!!

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2014 06:41AM annika12 wrote: I have had two lumpectomies with a wire localisation first and they both went pretty easy and smooth. Never took pain pills but used a lot if ice packs so have many on hand , small and soft worked best for me. I also had to wear a bra for 72 hrs so I got a few new comfy ones. I was totally scared of the wire thing but it went pretty easy too, uncomfortable but not painful !! Good luck with both surgery and results :)
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy tomorrow! Any advice? gkhtoys Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2013 05:42PM annika12 wrote: kiko- eat what you can when you can!! I had to try a lot of things I just didn't know if I could eat it until I tried it. Soup, cut up cucumbers, cut up nectarines, popsicles were some of the things I could eat. And then in your non chemo weeks make sure you eat good and healthy, you need to stay strong. Don't be hard on yourself.......rest if you need :) You can do this, you are not alone!!!
Posts.Title: In Total Shock!!!!!!! carissabforlife Kiko

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2013 04:16PM annika12 wrote: I used a stool softener but also heat pillows on my stomach and baths!!!!

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2013 08:46PM annika12 wrote: I'm so sorry!! My heart breaks for you as a remember to well those first few weeks. You are in the hardest part,when you get "the plan " of action your worrier mode will kick in and it WILL get better. I told my self many days TODAY I'm ok !! You will have bad days but you will also have good days...live them and laugh with your kids.Except help and hugs from friends :) In the beginning I watched a lot of movies at night.....my brain couldn't think about two things at once!!! Hang in there hugs!!
